description: Extract Schedule E rental property data for Form 1038 worksheet
prompt:
You are a mortgage underwriting assistant. Analyze this Schedule E (Supplemental Income and Loss) and extract the rental property data into the JSON structure below. Be precise with dollar amounts. If a field is not present or blank, use 0 for amounts and null for strings.

Return ONLY valid JSON, no commentary:

{
  "taxYear": "number — the tax year on the Schedule E",
  "propertyAddress": "string — the property address from Part I, or null",
  "fairRentalDays": "number — Fair Rental Days shown on Schedule E, 0 if not shown",
  "rentsReceived": "number — Line 3 (Rents received), 0 if blank",
  "totalExpenses": "number — Line 20 (Total expenses), 0 if blank",
  "insurance": "number — Line 9 (Insurance), 0 if blank",
  "mortgageInterest": "number — Line 12 (Mortgage interest paid), 0 if blank",
  "taxes": "number — Line 16 (Taxes), 0 if blank",
  "depreciation": "number — Line 18 (Depreciation expense or depletion), 0 if blank",
  "totalIncome": "number — Line 21 (Net income or loss), for reference"
}

Important rules:
- taxYear is critical — find it in the form header
- Rents received (Line 3) is the gross rental income
- Total expenses (Line 20) includes all expense items — this will be subtracted
- Lines 9, 12, 16, 18 are individual expense items that get added BACK (they are already included in Line 20)
- Fair Rental Days tells us how many months the property was in service
- If multiple properties are listed, extract data for the FIRST property only
- Do NOT confuse Part I (rental real estate) with Part II (partnerships/S-corps)
